isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - HIGH-PRESSURE OIL PUMP - Removal - High-pressure Oil Pump Cover

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

note.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.
The Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) valve must be removed before removing the high-pressure oil pump cover.
Some engines have a metal heat shield mounted over the IPR valve; others have an insolated snap cover on the IPR valve solenoid.

step1.para: Remove three rear exhaust heat shield mounting bolts and the two IPR valve heat shield bolts (if installed).
Remove the IPR valve insolated snap cover (if installed).

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting electrical components.

step1.para: Disconnect engine harness connector from IPR valve.
Remove IPR valve from high-pressure oil pump.
Remove and discard O-rings and backup ring.

figure.caption: Removal of high-pressure oil pump cover

note.para: The high-pressure oil pump can be replaced with out removing the EGR cooler, if the exhaust pipe is loosened or removed.

step1.para: Remove five M6 x 25 hex flange bolts from high-pressure oil pump cover.
Loosen and completely back out three M6 x 25 hex flange bolts under the EGR cooler. Leave these bolts loose in the cover

note.para: These bolts will be removed after removal of oil pump cover.

figure.caption: Separation of sealant with thin scraper

step1.para: Use a thin gasket scraper to separate sealant between crankcase, rear cover seam, and high-pressure oil pump cover. Do this on both sides at the rear of the pump cover.

figure.caption: Removal of high-pressure oil pump cover

step1.para: After breaking sealant, lift the pump cover side - opposite the EGR cooler - at an angle to clear pump gear, and lift cover from pump.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not lose or allow the three bolts in the cover to fall down into the crankcase.
